reviews.sentence: Nice hotel in a good location. Its an older building but the rooms have been modernized and were very clean. The staff at the hotel is excellent friendly and accommodating. Bed was comfortable everything in the room was working well. it is a couple of blocks from windandsea beach which we both like walking around. Short driving distance from La Jola Cove and Prospect St downtown. it is a bargain that is centrally located. Definitely would return.
La Jola CA Secret. An exceptional location front desk folks clean room and value. I do not travel a lot but am pretty darn picky when I do.

Great Location. Recently spent a week at the LaJola Travelodge. Close to the beach a few short blocks. Easy to navigate to all locales. LaJola Cove Mission Beach and Pacific Beach. Excellent staff very knowledgeable and helpful and friendly. Definitely would stay again. Clean compact rooms staff and location make this a hit.

Sweet surprise. We were not expecting much for the money in this hotel in a spendy area. It was a great point redemption hotel. So clean great location and super staff. We will stay there again and look at other Travelodges as a result.
Very polite customer service and cleaners. Also acomodating to our needs and questions with a good sense of humor. We felt very welcome on our first trip to San Diego and would recommend anyone.
Best Beach Location and Restaurants. Wind N Sea Beach Location and friendly staff.

Great location very close to the beach and to the tourist attractions. The stuff at the reception was absolutely fantastic starting from the man at our arrival unfortunately I have forgotten his name ending on the lady at our departure Tricia. Their great customer friendly attitude made such a big difference. The hotel was very close to the beach and within a nice walking distance from the major tourist attractions in La Jola. Parking really easy. Small continental breakfast.
Good. Lovely sunny smile welcome from the front desk staff good breakfast buffet. Access to the car park was a little tricky as it ’s on a one way street.

Value for your money. Exceptionally happy and good service at the front desk a German speaking woman she is a keeper. The hotel was perfectly situated. Definitely value for your money. The rooms were old but however they were clean. Something that you would expect for the price.

Wonderful. Staff was very friendly and accommodating. The beach is a 3 minute walk and has some benches that you can sit on to enjoy the view. The location was amazing. The mini fridge was a full mini with a freezer and drawer. Check in out was quick easy and did not have any surprise fees. We were always able to find parking. There was construction going on on some of the rooms so it would be nice to see what updates they do to the rooms. We would definitely stay again. Thanks to the friendly front desk woman. The carpets are a bit dirty. The shower is a bit tight.

The room renovation was actually quite nice however the ongoing construction was very inconvenient. The staff made our 3 day stay tolerable but I would not go back there until at least the construction was complete. Even then it is probably at best a 3 on a 5 point scale. Parking is really tight breakfast was really minimal and carb heavy and the location was not as good as I had thought.
Hotel was going through renovation but the staff tried their best not to disturb the guests.

Great location friendly staff continental breakfast had great pastries rooms nicely remodeled enjoyed the pool and spa. Only downside was no where to put toiletries they need to at least put a shelf in the bathroom. There were n’t any towel bars but the staff said they were coming.

We had a great family reunion there as we have for 17 years. The location is great. Helpful staff. We missed the former staff of 17 years of which we have been coming that long. Communicating with the cleaning staff was difficult because they did not speak English.

We had a great family reunion there as we have for 17 years. The location is great. Helpful staff. We missed the former staff of 17 years of which we have been coming that long. Communicating with the cleaning staff was difficult because they did not speak English.

Excellent. Nicely furnished rooms. Comfy bed. Massive shower. Liked the outdoor fire pit. Good location. There was a bit of a mix up with our booking and they wanted to put us in a room in reception. After a long journey down there that was n’t happening. Luckily the lady managed to find us a different room. However it was ground floor and quiet noisy.
Very comfortable and clean in a great location. Check in out was slow due to computer issues but staff was very friendly and polite. Great price. Will definitely stay again.

Luckily the room we had was clean and well appointed. Newly renovated and clean. Bokingcom did not communicate with Shoal hotel the type of room I reserved. So when we got there desk rep said the only room left was the standard king room and not the king de luxe.

One star is for the hotel staff in the front office. They are sweet girls. The other star is for location as you can walk to the beach. Lack of stars for the following. First night our good old neighbors were blasting their tv so loud our room was shaking there was constant fighting which I do n’t know if it was due to the people or the movie. Went to front desk to ask if we could switch rooms and they said the people were checking out that day. Okay fine. Then called to say they asked them to check out early due to the inconvenience. They only had an hour left before they had to check out but I appreciated the gesture. Second and third mornings I discovered room 21 is right next to the cleaning ladies who scream their good morning conversations to each other right in front of our room waking us up in kind of an annoying manner with more screaming and yelling every morning. Cute place but thankfully it ’s our last night. If room 21 is offered do n’t take the cleaning staff is in their defense and just doing their job. But try to have some respect for ur guests who are tired after long days of sight seeing and surfing. All in all not worth the 159 charged us per night. Spa is yellow as well and does n’t seem very clean. Again cute place but not worth the issues.

Great location. Close to the beach. The Shoal is very clean trendy and the beds are super comfortable. Shout out to the front desk staff Casey and Chris. Both were so friendly and helpful. And Chris came to the rescue when we noticed a dog in a hot car parked on the street. We had a lovely time and would stay here again.

We were glad to have a relatively inexpensive place to sleep in this high priced town. Thank you. Does not serve breakfast. We were in a handicap room and it appeared clean but was rather cold and spartan. The king size bed was comfortable. Our complaints are the following 1 the shower only dribbled water. We were told when we complained to the front desk the shower handle needs to be turned in the counter clockwise direction. We actually had tried it but it did not work. We may have not pushed hard enough. Written instructions would have been helpful. 2. No shower floor mat. 3 No washcloths. 4. No place to hang any towels.
